DataElement.preferredName: Lymphedema Symptom Intensity and Distress Survey-Arm V 2.0 During Past Week Have Swelling in Your Arm Distress Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation about the distress level of having swelling in their arm during the past week, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lymphedema Symptom Intensity and Distress Survey-Arm During Past Week Have Swelling in Your Arm Distress Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-report tool designed to evaluate arm lymphedema and associated symptoms in breast cancer survivors._At some point in a given period of time._The most recent week. May include the present day._A question about whether an individual experiences or experienced swelling in their arm._A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Lymphedema Symptom Intensity and Distress Survey-Arm
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-report tool designed to evaluate arm lymphedema and associated symptoms in breast cancer survivors.

Concepts.definition: At some point in a given period of time.
The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question about whether an individual experiences or experienced swelling in their arm.
A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Symptoms Intensity and Distress 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A scale for the subjective scoring of a symptom's intensity and distress that ranges from 1: Slight to 5: Severe._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 5 on a symptom's intensity and distress scale that ranges from 1: Slight to 5: Severe.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 5 on a symptom's intensity and distress scale that ranges from 1: Slight to 5: Severe.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
